item.title: Flytipping opposite 3- 4 Graham Terrace Westerham Drive, 28th November
item.description:
Someone has dumped a yellow cone, pieces of blue plastic/rubber and other rubbish on the pavement. This has been there for at least a week ago. Please can it be removed asap before people add more to it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Graham Terrace, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inadequate signage indicating cycle and pedestrian paths, 28th November
item.description:
The section of the Dollis Valley Greenwalk between Western Way to Totteridge Lane begins as shared use and then splits into a cycle path and a pedestrian path through to Totteridge lane, there are signs at either end of each section indicating which is cycle and which is pedestrian, however these signs are small, aged and vandalised. There are no pathway markings once people have passed the signs. Frequently there are pedestrians on the cycle path, e.g. today, one lady pushing a pram glued to her phone, she would not have seen the signs but might have seen pathway markings. There are frequently dog walkers with unpredictable dogs. Recently I pings a couple from behind with my bell, having slowed down to almost a stop, and the male took issue with this, I reminded it was a cycle path and he denied it was and threatened to punch me and throw my bike into the brook. I suspect with proper signage people would realised sooner, or at least when they encounter a bike. This section of the green walk is on cycle route planners so cyclists do use it, and given there is provision for cycles steps should be taken to reduce conflict and the scope for harm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dollis Valley Greenwalk, Whetstone, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
